class.name: Paladin
class.shortfluff: You are a divine warrior, an armor-clad protector of your faith, and are able to issue challenges that compel your foes to fight you rather than your allies.
class.fluff: As a Paladin, you are an indomitable warrior who has pledged your prowess to something greater than yourself. You smite enemies with divine authority, bolster the courage of nearby companions, and radiate as if a beacon of inextinguishable hope. As Paladin, you are transfigured on the field of battle, an exemplar of divine ethos in action.

To a Champion is given the responsibility to unflinchingly stand before an enemy's charge, smiting them with your sword while protecting your allies with your sacrifice. Where others waver and wonder, your motivation is pure and simple, and your devotion is your strength. You refuse to allow temptation to dissuade you from your obligations.

Champions following the edicts of evil gods are known as Blackguards among the common folk. While often more ruthless in their methods, they are no less devoted to their cause than the Champions of good.

feature.name: Channel Divinity
feature.benefit: You can invoke divine power, filling yourself with might derived from your cause. This power allows you to wield special powers.
Once per encounter, you can use a Channel Divinity power.
You gain the divine mettle and divine strength Channel Divinity powers.

Feats and other abilities can grant you additional Channel Divinity powers. Unless the ability specifically says otherwise, you can still only use one Channel Divinity power in an encounter. If an ability allows you to regain the use of your Channel Divinity, you can use any Channel Divinity power you know, even the same one.

power.title: Divine Mettle
power.fluff: Your unswerving faith in your cause empowers a nearby creature to resist a debilitating affliction

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target makes a saving throw against one effect that a save can end. It has a bonus to the roll equal to your Wisdom modifier.

power.title: Divine Strength
power.fluff: You call upon divine strength to lay low your enemies

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The next attack you make gains a bonus to damage. The bonus equals your Strength modifier.

feature.name: Divine Sanction
feature.benefit: A Champion's challenge is filled with divine menace, punishing foes that ignore it.
You can place enemies under your Divine Sanction. The duration of your sanction and the number of creatures sanctioned depends on the ability you use.

An enemy under your sanction is marked by you and, once between the starts of your turns, it immediately takes radiant damage if it targets your allies with an attack that doesn't include you as a target. The radiant damage equals 3 + your Charisma modifier, and increases to 6 + your Charisma modifier at 11th level, and to 9 + your Charisma modifier at 21st level.
If the enemy under your sanction is no longer marked by you, the sanction also immediately ends.
You gain the divine challenge class power that allows you to challenge a single foe with your sanction.

power.title: Divine Challenge
power.fluff: You boldly confront a nearby enemy, searing it with divine light if it ignores your challenge

section.name: Target:
section.target: one creature that can see you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You place the target under your Divine Sanction until you use this power again.
The sanction also ends at the end of your turn if you didn't engage the target, meaning you neither attacked it during your turn nor are adjacent to it at the end of your turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can use this power only once per turn.

feature.name: Hand of the Cause
feature.benefit: A Champion is almost always a person of action. He or she has a hands-on approach, both figuratively and literally.
When you make a melee basic attack, you can use your Charisma modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack roll and damage roll.
Also, choose either Ardent Vow, Lay on Hands, or Virtue's Touch to represent how you approach your duties.

subfeature.name: Ardent Vow
subfeature.benefit: An Ardent Vow Champion focuses as much on bringing down the enemies of his or her cause as on protecting his or her allies.
Your Divine Sanction deals one-half damage when a creature under your sanction makes an attack that includes at least one of your allies and you as a target.
Also, you gain the ardent vow class power.

power.title: Ardent Vow
power.fluff: You reach toward your foe and draw on unwavering faith and inner strength, so your next strike is filled with divine fury

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The first attack you make against the target before the end of your next turn gains a bonus to damage equal to 4 + your Strength modifier.
Until the end of the encounter, whenever you attack the target, you subject it to your Divine Sanction until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can use this power a number of times per day equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once), but only once per round.

subfeature.name: Lay on Hands
subfeature.benefit: A Champion that can lay on hands is there to shield his or her allies, and then to patch their wounds when that is not enough.
Your number of healing surges increases by 1.
Also, you gain the lay on hands class power.

power.title: Lay on Hands
power.fluff: Your divine touch instantly heals wounds

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must have at least one healing surge remaining.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You spend a healing surge, and the target regains hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can use this power a number of times per day equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once), but only once per round.

subfeature.name: Virtue's Touch
subfeature.benefit: Wielding the Virtue's Touch, a Champion can ease the pain and suffering of those in need.
You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws against effects that blind, daze, slow, stun or weaken you. Your DM might allow you to apply this bonus against other effects as well.
Also, you gain the virtue's touch class power.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You remove one of the following conditions from the target:
Blinded, dazed, deafened, slowed, stunned, or weakened. Your DM might allow you to remove other conditions or effects.

Instead of removing a condition, you can choose to give the target a power bonus to Endurance checks to resist disease until the end of his or her next extended rest. The bonus equals 1 + one-half your Wisdom modifier, and also applies to Heal checks to treat the target's disease.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can use this power a number of times per day equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once), but only once per round.
